title: Symmetry and the Beauty Bias
description: Learn Symmetry and the Beauty Bias in one minute.

buildup.text: Evolutionary biologists say symmetry signals healthy genes. Asymmetry can indicate developmental stress.

discovery.text: Across 37 cultures, studies found that symmetrical faces are consistently rated more attractive.

twist.text: But perfectly symmetrical faces look eerie. We prefer near-symmetry â€” close to perfect, but still human.

climax.text: Our attraction to symmetry is hardwired, but true beauty lives in the slight imperfections we love.

punchline.text: Perfect symmetry is unsettling. Near-perfect is irresistible.

quiz.question: Why do evolutionary biologists say we prefer symmetrical faces?
